It‚Äôs well run and easy to navigate. If you go early evening there‚Äôs a free light show which is magnificent. We‚Äôd purposely planned our trip to start in Singapore to be able to visit the gardens and weren‚Äôt disappointed.

We heard that the beat time to visit it was in the late afternoon or early evening, so we went there at around 5. The gardens are well kept and the cloud forest is amazing. The food, satay by the bay was fantastic(we had satay and chilli crab). But it was an absolutely nightmare to get a taxi to return to the hotel. We had to queue up for more than an hour to get the taxi. The other option was to pay more to get a taxi( S$50). We refused. We were miserable by having to wait too long. Singapore added a bitter taste to our trip. Too crowded. Only if you are willing to pay more you can get the best services. Everything comes with a price.

Lovely Poinsettia X'mas at Flower Dome. Cool stalls and lovely choruses at X'mas Wonderland. Lightshow and soap snow was cute too.
Too bad the layout was poor as e-ticket holders can only exchange for physical tickets at a booth at the Visitor Centre, despite the different entrances stating 'online tickets'. Super uncool to have to traverse from the Meadow all the way to the Visitor Centre in the rain. Also uncool that diners cannot enter Supertree Grove without the X'mas Wonderland ticket.

REVIEW_TITLE: plan to spend several hours and too much money
REVIEW_BODY: We bought the double attraction tickets to the flower dome and the Cloud Forest. There was a line to get into the Cloud Forest Dome but it was only about 10 minutes. It kept moving. We were so excited to get in and feel the cool air and see the massive waterfall. Then we started walking inside and realized there was another really long line. We had no idea. So we waited about 50 minutes in a line to get to the elevator. The line keeps moving and you are walking along pretty flower beds as you wait in line, but it's a FIFTY minute line. No way to use stairs to go up. We contemplated NOT waiting and going up but we are SO glad we did. The views and walkways from the top are really amazing and just seeing the stuff on the main path at the bottom would NOT have been worth the money. As it is, it's a really expensive way to see some flowers. Many cities have botanical gardens for a few dollars that are just as beautiful. I'm glad I went ONCE, just to see it. But I'll never go again. Not for that price. Not too mention, the super long line inside the Cloud Forest dome made it so we didn't have enough time to do the Flower Dome. So money wasted. We also bought tickets to do the walkway. We bought the tickets about 4pm. And then went back about 6pm to get our "assigned time" which happened to be 7:40 which was awesome because we were ON the walkway during the 7:45 light show. The walkway was really fun and totally worth the $8 price. The line to use the elevator was short and easy, since they assign times (after 5pm they start assigning times on a first come first serve basis. you can get in the line to go up the elevator at your assigned time. It makes it really doable. But need to buy tickets a few hours early!!!) . They light show was really fun and the views were incredible and we all really enjoyed it. When the light show finished everyone was hungry for dinner so we went to the foodcourt place right there at the super trees. It was PACKED! It took some in our group 2 hours to get their food. crazy! During that time we were able to step outside and easily see the 8:45 light show from the ground. Really fun to see from the ground also. I do NOT recommend going to the foodcourt anytime after 7:30. The food is mediocre and pricey and the place was a madhouse! If we didn't have hungry kids with us, we would definitely have just walked and found something else. It's a really fun area to walk around and explore. Lots of nice walking paths. Great in the evening with the cooler weather and all the lights and buildings and water. I'll go back to the area to walk around and enjoy the paths but I will NOT pay for the domes again and we probably won't do the walkway or light show again. Once was enough. It's too crowded. Definitely take water and eat elsewhere. We did refill water bottles using the drinking fountain near the bathrooms. We walked there from Chinatown. 30 minute walk or 27 minutes on metro. So we walked and it was a really nice walk!

Amazing place, so many things to attract. The lights are very colorful the greens are good in the eye. Very crowded but fun and the dancing music light was really amazing and the fireworks. This place are good to recommend for family and friend.
You need to be reasonably fit to visit here . It‚Äôs worth a look though . Take water with you . It‚Äôs very hot walking around .
Christmas decoration this year looks so gorgeous. I really surprise with a lot of beautiful views. Worth of doing sightseeing

We visited on Christmas eve 2019 for the Christmas light show. All i can say is that it is a massive security hazard waiting to be set off. There were throngs of people trying to leave at around 8 with lots more trying to get in via one staircase from the Gardens to the bridge leading to marina Bay Sands through one set of escalators down to the shopping complex. Just imagine the chaos if there was an incident that triggered a stampede.

The show itself was nice but a bit repetitive. We werent told the ODBC skyway was closed at 4 so we would have to come back another day to that. The Flower dome was a bit ordinary but the Cloud Forest was great with fantastic architecture. The Skyway itself was short but we were fortunate to visit during a solar eclipse so spent time up there watching the eclipse. It's certainly unique enough to visit once and tick that off your list. Not sure it warrants repeated visits.

Getting to Garden By the Bay may be easy. You can either take the MRT (Downtown Line or Circle Line) and alight at the Bayfront station. Then you walk along the connecting walkway linking to the Garden By the Bay (there‚Äôs a lift). Then buy tickets to Flower Dome and Cloud Forest if you want and take a stroll to the venue. With a stroller, I recommend the Flower Dome but not the Cloud Forest as the queue for lifts can be long. Then you can stroll to Satay by the Bay to have some satay. It can be really crowded on weekends and public holidays. Then walk to Supertree Grove to watch the night lighting show (please check the time). The show lasts for 15 minutes. If you watch the last show at 8:30pm, please take note that it is very challenging to catch a cab when the show ends. For express taxi in order to avoid queue, you will be charged $30 to Marina Bay Sands, and other destinations $50 which is ridiculous. To avoid that, take a stroll and locate Silver Garden and then cross the link to Marina Bay Sands for Bayfront MRT Station.

A must visit when you‚Äôre in Singapore. Avoid the long queue for tickets by purchasing online in advance. It is ideal to print out the tickets too (as they will need to stamp on the tickets).

Cloud Forest & Flower Dome:
If you buy tickets for this combo, you‚Äôll able to enjoy it for the whole day. You could also do re entry for both venues. Just make sure to get the re entry stamp at the exit. You‚Äôll spend 45mins to 1 hour minimum at each dome. Remember you can come back to visit these domes for the whole day.

Super Grove Trees:
You will need to get the tickets separately from the Cloud Forest & Flower Dome. You‚Äôll spend 45-1 hour here depending on how long you plan your visit. If you‚Äôre shooting a pro photo, it may be longer.

Flora Fantasy:
This is a separate exhibition and no re-entry is allowed. There‚Äôs a 4D Show before you exit. You will spend approximately 45 mins to 1 hour here.

Team Lab showcase:
This is showing currently till March 2020. You will need to ride on the shuttle to get here. You can purchase at the ticket counter for 3 dollars per person. Get a stamp as you are able to ride the shuttle for the whole day.

Tips:
Go early morning so you can enjoy the venues at slow pace without many people.

Go on weekdays if possible. Weekends are usually very crowded. In general, this place is very popular.

Grab Car or take a cab if you can. No need to struggle to get a parking if you‚Äôre driving in the island. This place can be quite competitive to score a parking at peak hour.

If you‚Äôve re entry stamps for Cloud Forest & Flower Dome - you can come back in the evening. You will be able to enjoy TeamLab eggs lights and also the music show at Super Grove Trees.

Hope it helps. Enjoy!

REVIEW_TITLE: Family with elderly and young children
REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice place for family with elderly and young children. Other than seeing plants from different regions there are also many spots for photo taking. Good for both knowledge and entertainment. Highly recommended!

We spent a fantastic couple of hours in the early evening to late watching the lights come on and just walking around the gardens. Absolutely beautiful and serene. Lots of people but everyone seemed also to accept that the experience was special and not a lot of noise. Most just sat and watched each of the light sculptures come to life. With the Marina Bay Sands in the background it was really beautiful.
Truely recommended

REVIEW_TITLE: I love the lights at Christmas Village
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is huge and I didn't have time to see everything but the lights and decorations at Christmas Village wowed us all.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens light show to music wonderful night
REVIEW_BODY: Very magical and lights show to music on a beautiful evening excellent gift shop splendid too can just stop and watch and listen

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for a day trip
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens, must visit if you are in Singapore. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes since there is a lot of walking!

You will need half a day to walk round the gardens.
You have to pay extra for some things though.
The water fall was lovely.

Floral fantasy 4D ride is really worth watching, my girls love it so much. The newly opened Supertree observation desk is below our expectation. The sheltered observatory floor is blocking a lot of the views due to its structure.
It was Fantastic. I wish I spent more time but was in a rush. The super tree is a must visit. I'd like to go again at night. I'm sure the views would be spectacular!!! Definitely recommend

The gardens are a must visit. They are filled with the most beautiful and well kept flowers. Grounds are spotless and staff are very friendly and knowledgable about the gardens. Plenty of gift shops and places to get food a drink, although it was on the pricer side. Hours could have been spent at the gardens looking at the beautiful displays they have. It is an attraction like no other I have ever seen and would highly recommend. Very easy to get to by taxi.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to Cloud Forest & Flower Dome
REVIEW_BODY: It was a good visit. We especially enjoyed the visit to Cloud Forest. The orchids there were very beautiful and many of them we saw them the first time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Place to Visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is easily the best place to visit in Singapore especially during the Christmas period. However you need to pay to get into the Christmas Wonderland (carnival games and christmas market with the main decorated structure) but it comes with fun and performances too.

Beautiful gardens, varied displays, thought provoking themes, amazing design
Fabulous few hours spent here. Plenty of options for food and drink
Well worth a visit

Very beautiful gardens to see even if you do not go into the domes: they are spectacular. Nice play area for the kids. Take the bus rather than the MRT because the approach through the hotel is interesting and you get a great "first view" of the towers.

REVIEW_TITLE: Christmas at Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: The Christmas music and snow machine was great for visitors of all ages. The aerial bridge was the highlight of the night, we enjoyed seeing the view at this height and listening to the Christmas music. The food and home made crafts were fun to browse.

If you‚Äôre in Singapore, this is a must-do. Free entrance, with lots of paying attractions within this park. Best time is around sunset to enjoy the 19:45 PM (free) light show. The park itself is a lush green oasis in a bustling city. Totally enjoyable and recommended!

Gardens by the bay , is a rejuvenating refreshment to the eyes and soul and breaks any negative bias associated with the term 'Gardens' you might have.

It has two paid parks Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. The Former is a manmade representation of how forest in Amazon grows, beautiful, falls, mists and walkway created to give you a feel of what it could be.

Flower Dome is a collection of various flowers , as do exist in a typical garden but with a modern feel.

Besides there's a OCBC skyway, good for a one time visit but reach before sunset if you want to have nice photos. However the associated laser show towards end of day ( 2 timings) is really interesting.

There's a lot of free area associated with Gardens by the bay which is a very nice 2 hours walk to the Gardens and a good day visit to locals. If you are visiting Singapore for a short time, it can be completely skipped.

Not being a plant or garden person I wasn't sure if this would live up to my expectations but it exceeded them! Absolutely amazing place to visit and such good value. Lucky enough to visit over Christmas break so Christmas theme kept it interesting for Miss 9! Went to both Flower Dome and Cloud Forest and highly recommend both.

I hadnt done much research so was blown away by the set up of these gardens. The architect is to be commended. There was a great variety of plants displayed in all kinds of displays. The air con domes were a welcome relief. Went to the 4D show which was unique. I liked going on the boardwalks to see display from a height. Stunning arrangement on rock face with waterfall. In all, I loved it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Try to go there at night
REVIEW_BODY: We were there day and night. Day time was very hot, we bought the ticket for the train ride which run through the whole garden and was beautiful. We went back at night again for the music and light show, it was free and really beautiful. Check their website for show time.
Excellent for a half day of flower-admiring. Of course, the place is VERY crowded, but we thought it was worth it!

We walked over the helix bridge to get there which apparently a lot of people miss! It‚Äôs a very beautiful structure.

At the gardens; barely any lines if you‚Äôre there at 10am.
We bought the pass combined for these attractions with included shuttle (which is so worth it on a hot day). Floral fantasy had the nicest flowers but cloud Forrest was just amazing especially with the mist going. Flower dome was also nice but my least favourite.

Bought separate ticket to the new Supertree observation deck on the first day it was open. don‚Äôt forget to go to the rooftop! Best views in Singapore because you can see the sky deck and super trees, Ferris Wheel and harbour. You don‚Äôt need to do the other Supertree walking path as the views are similar but not as high.

Good selection for lunch at the food hall including gluten free options at the Vietnamese.
We walked back over through marina bay sands and filled in the rest of the afternoon walking around marina bay. A big walking day but a great way to see the area.

We came back that night to watch the super trees light show. It was amazing. You also don‚Äôt need a ticket to enter the park and watch the show. Tip; watch from down amongst the trees themselves!

Recommended for a great day.

it is a great Christmas event in Singapore..although to go to Gardrns by the Bay in mid November to 26th December have to pay for entrance tickets in the afternoon till night..but the decoration and the blizzard moment combined with the garden raphsody is a beautiful magical view that you don't get such experience everytime..so once we have to try it..beside there are others activities like theatre and playing games, and a lot of famous food stalls we can enjoy..

Such an amazing place to visit. Spent hours here. From early morning to evening. Seriously beautiful and gorgeous. Lovingly looked after from the living giant metal trees, the tree top walk, dragonfly sculptures, to the big floating baby to the wonderful and varied plant species. Magical place worth every minute wondering through all the different global garden designs. Then to top it off the spectacular light show. Just the icing on the cake.
I really love this place. Offers plenty of different types of flowers with state-of-art facility. Highly recommended.

Two gigantic domes packed with plants & trees from around the world. We were lucky enough to see the Christmas display.
We were in each domes for 2 hours, so much to see. An absolute credit to the staff who design and maintain these stunning displays.
Allow yourself plenty of time to appreciate these popular attractions.

One of the best tourist attraction in the city and it's one of the main reason I'm here in Singapore. The garden is a huge complex consisting of two domes, the famous tree grove, and also small gardens representing a certain culture. The most popular ones are the domes, tourists should definitely experience both. The tree grove can be seen from a far (if it's enough for you) or wait until dark to see the light shows. Admission price is expensive but definitely worth the money.
What a beautiful place and you can get some awesome photos here. Be mindful of the indoor waterfall as there is a lot of spray and the conservatories are a bit chilly. A great concept though!

The minute we entered we asked the information counter about hiring the buggy or if shuttle services were available. There information desk clearly declined nothing as such is available and we have to walk all the way. In the end when we were visiting the cloud dome we saw the shuttles operatoring and the buggy rides also on rent. Highly disappointed because of this.
Other wise the Gardens are beautiful to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Crazy busy and a bit of a yawn
REVIEW_BODY: This review is aimed at westerners who are fortunate enough to have travelled a bit. We were less than impressed with the domes at gardens by the bay. The flower done was basically the plants we grow in our garden (which are not native to Singapore) and the cloud dome was mildly interesting, but the crowds and wait times put us off. The free and public gardens did look like they were worth time and we would have gone back for an afternoon if we could have. We were there on the Sunday before Christmas and the crowds were unpleasant. We did see the Christmas display at night and the super tree light show which was impressive. If I was advising visitors, I would recommend finding out the slower times and I would question whether or not the domes are worth the entry fee. The super trees are worth seeing at night and the public park looks excellent. If you want to see indigenous plants, however, the botanical gardens are more likely to please.

Visited the Gardens by the Bay at Christmas time....
During the day it was a visit to the Flower and Cloud Forest Domes, which were really impressive.
Then a return in the evening, when the light show was the main attraction.
However, as it was Christmas time, there was an additional benefit of the Christmas lights...and the general fun and merriment of the occasion.
Well worth a visit, at any time of year.

Was not expecting much but was very pleasantly surprised. A great variety of different types of gardens, all cleverly laid out. Lots and lots of photo opportunities. Was here at Xmas and many of the displays were xmas orientated which i found excessive, but i am sure others would have liked it. Best buy combined entry with the Cloud Forest.
Love it so much! Amazing water fall and love the nature conserved! Best part is you get to know lots of plants & lego session. Amazing!
Beautiful and Amazing lightshow in the evening. Also beautiful at Day time. Beautiful garden surrounding the place. You can also have a picnic with you family. Only say Beautiful place. Must visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views, but a rip off
REVIEW_BODY:
The Marina Bay hotel is an iconic building and going to the top was a must. Unfortunately the inflexibility once up there was very disappointing.
Initially we were going to purchase tickets for the viewing platform, at a cost of $26 per ticket, however we were informed that there was no seating and no shade. As it was a very hot day, we desperately needed some shade, so we opted for option 2, and that was to visit the bar on another section of the Observation deck. Prior to visiting the bar we had to purchase two drinks vouchers for $23 per drink. Once we were up there, we were told we could not sit inside the air conditioning part as this was for food. We sat outside, thankfully there was shade. We were then told the drink vouchers covered the drinks but not the tax. This cost us an additional $8.
The bizarre and most frustrating thing, is we were not allowed to go to the $26 observation deck, even though they were next to each other and separated by fake moveable hedges. We were told if we wanted to visit that section we would need to go back to ground floor and purchase tickets at a cost of $26 a ticket.

I went up to the bar at the sky park and what a view. The skies were a little cloudy hence not a clear vision. But I enjoyed a cocktail and relaxed during sunset. Lovely hotel but lots of people.
Best to visit during early hours. There is a shopping mall at the hotel and many eateries as well.

The creator of the Marina Bay Sands Skypark was smart. It was a license to print money. Of course, you're in Singapore, you have to go. But the Singapore skyline is not very impressive. It sure isn't New York, London, Tokyo, Bangkok or many others. It's a pretty small skyline. And as for the lightshow. That's incredibly weak. Not a patch on the one at the Bellagio, Las Vegas, or the one by The Address in Dubai. Singapore really needs to try better.
Cost was over $100 for 2 Adults & 2 kids, way too much for the view.. we passed, then it rained, so lucky choice for us.

You honestly stay here for the Pool. The hotel room was really basic for how much it costs to stay here. Nothing special, very basic and clean but not worth the price tag. The food, shops, and the service are amazing. There's a lot to do at all times either shopping, eating, dancing etc but the pool is where its at. The view, the food and drink was just amazing. It could have been a little warmer, the water is freezing but it was worth it to stay for one night.
Short layover in singapore, we cannot miss Marina Bay. They have beaches as well near which is a to do for next time

One of those things they say you have to do, but wouldn't do it again. Great view, especially at night, but not really worth the fee or the crowd. Getting up was easy but had to wait in line 20mins for an elevator down.

The view was nice and you could see a big part of singapore and (especially) gardens by the bay area. However, there were many people sitting down right beside the glass viewing ares and sits there for HOURS just to wait for the Supergrove light show at 8pm. Because of this, it is really hard to get a closer view of the city since space taken up by these INCONSIDERATE PEOPLE!. There is a restaurant above as well, however only open to hotel guests. The small beverage stand had very little variety of drinks and serves no food. And charges MIND BENDING prices for Tiger Beer (which is a horrible beer i might add). And in case youre wondering....no the pool is not accessible by non-hotel guests.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very efficient entry and cheerful staff
REVIEW_BODY:
Went at 10 am on a Monday got a self service ticket very easy. No queue to go in lift and staff cheerful and helpful
It was a clearish day so good views
Make sure this is on your list of things to go to and see the views are amazing , we went at night but I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs amazing during the day also .
This is for those who like viewing the City from a very high place. Before going to Skypark, there is a mall with so many shops for shopaholics.

Starting with the superfast liift the visit to the viewing platform was a thrilling experience. We could see all the lights,, harbour,, Marina Bayand the Singapore skyline, all enhanced by an icecream from the platform cafe.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best to leave this for the people staying in the hotel
REVIEW_BODY:
Yes - you can see Singapore. Yes - you can get epic pictures. Yes - it is kinda a must thin to do.

However maybe plan your trip in a way that you are staying at the hotel instead of just booking a ticket to visit the bar.

The pool is a beautiful location to relax and watch the city through out the day but expect to be interrupted by the regular #tag Face Snap into chatters. Actually its hilarious watching them prepare and pose for their perfect picture and then argue with their family/friends because they didn't get it right.

My partner and I paid to go and access the Skypark as we had seen the building on TV from overseas and wanted to check out the views and the overall design.
Very very disappointed with the overall attraction.It looked like there were 2 x cafes on the roof of which were open but not able to access them . There was no public seating and you are not able to go anywhere else unless you are staying at the Skypark.
The views were great - can‚Äôt complain about that but I thought it was very overpriced for what it was. Very misleading as I thought it was a sky garden not just boards

REVIEW_TITLE: Overpriced and not really worth it
REVIEW_BODY:
My wife and I paid to go and access the Skypark as we had seen the building on TV from overseas and wanted to check out the views and the overall design.
Bit disappointed with the overall attraction. We arrived around 10:30am with not many people around. It looked like there were 2 x cafes on the roof neither of which were open. There was no public seating or any amenities on the roof area around the Skypark.
The views were great - can‚Äôt complain about that but I thought it was very overpriced for what it was. We went to Jewel @ Singapore Airport later in the day and it was fantastic and cost us nothing üòé

Great view across the bay and a lot of the Singapore skyscrapers even when a little misty due to weather
Even better at night when lit up
We were lucky to be staying in the hotel so we were able to look around on several different occasions. Still a magnificent view whenever you look!

So we went there as Singapore trip is not complete without it .. but trust me it can be..

It was so crowded there was no space and as seen everywhere in Singapore there was no planning or crowd management. They were giving tickets to any number of people creating a fish market and as per review and research it's the case most of times.

Would suggest to book a table at CAfe la ve, you don't have to take the entry ticket of 32 SGD and can actually eat/drink something for that money.

Also such a waste of paper with printing everyone's pic and trying to sell it with no luck, obviously MBS will throw all the pics which were not sold. Again a very bad practice seen all over singapore.

Really bad practice from a country/orgs preaching so much about environment at every step.

The pool and the views from the sky park were the main reason for booking a stay at the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Rather hazy during our stay in November, but still great views. Pool was quieter in the morning than in late afternoon/early evening but possible to get sun loungers and to enjoy a swim in the pool.

We went up and perched in a bar at the top the views across the bay and over the city is fantastic. It is easily accessible from the downstairs lobby at the side of the hotel. Well worth a couple of hours of your time.

Ironically the best swimming pool experience.
Stunning views over the city from the pool both day and night and awesome views out to sea from behind the pool.
We arrived on a Sunday morning for a one night stay, the pool was not overly busy and certainly not crowded. there were lounges available the pool was not crowded with people taking selfies
I noticed there was an adult section of the pool and a children's further down.
The service was friendly
Best view on the city and certainly a landmark since the opening. But if you have it ticked, no need to return

If this is the only skyscraper you have ever visited in order to see a view, you might be impressed. Otherwise, if you have been to any of Empire State Building, Burj Khalifa, The Shard, etc, this is all a bit underwhelming. And the light show is really not worth hanging around for.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice for the view, but not much else going for it.
REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Marina Bay Sands Skypark on the night of the 2nd January and arrived just in time for the light show in the bay, which was pretty. The lights of Singapore and the Harbour are spectacular, as are the lights from Gardens By The Bay but there appeared to be very little else to this. Perhaps I'm reviewing the wrong thing, but there was no access to the pool pictured or anything other than a viewing platform and a caf√© which was full to bursting. Whilst I enjoyed the view, this isn't something I'd be bothered doing again.

My wife and I visited the upper deck of the Marina Bay Sands hotel on New Year‚Äôs Eve (2019), and we were blown away at the experience and the stunning panoramic views. It was enchanting, and we spent a couple of hours supping Prosecco, surveying the Singapore sights, and talking with like minded visitors. You pay for entry and in return you receive one complimentary drink, that is fair enough, as this deters those who would otherwise do a freebie visit just for the view. It‚Äôs a must, when visiting Singapore!

We went up there to the restaurant, they charged us Sin 25, but there is a Sin 20 drink voucher that we can be in used. So that was okay. All of my Girlfriends just want to have a look the overview of Singapore, and the endless pool. As that day we in was raining, so nothing much going around. After a drink, we came down to Marina Bay Sand Shopping mall for food!!

Great view from the top. Try to go during sunset or after sunset. You can see the beautiful skyline of Singapore including the stunning view of the Garden by the Bay. It is a bit expensive but one should go for the beautiful view it provides. Since i visited just before the new year it had very long queues and even to come down i had to wait 20 mins. The staff are very efficient and friendly. One must visit this place at least once.
The line is long but moves quickly. There is a small bar at the top with limited food options and expensive drinks. Only hotel guests are allowed to dine at the restaurant.

I am a bit affraid of heights, but braved the skypark. Glad I did, views for days and so peaceful. The process if quick to get up and the free drink is even better. You can download the free photo on your return

In simple terms there is nothing there except a view.
There is no real refreshment stalls and one tacky souvenir shop.

There is NO access to the swimming pool, which is actually what the MBS is famous for, it is only for hotel guests, even hotel guests visitors can not access it.

Save your money and go on the Singapore Flyer (wheel) which is nearby. You will get a much better view of the city, albeit another $10 or $15 more.

So do not waste your money at the Skypark.

Incidentally, we live in Singapore and have stayed at the hotel, the pool is not all it is cracked up to be anyway, my wife has also visited the skypark and said it was a waste of money.
We take all visitors on the Flyer, this is the best way to get a view of Singapore and pick out places of interest to visit later.
Thank you.

As I said in another review, the water is too cold to go into, so the only benefit I can see is to visit one of the sky park restaurants (there are several) overlooking the pool and people watch from the windows.There is also a bar on the upper deck if you drink. For those not living in the hotel there is a perfectly acceptable lookout deck--but with no beverages available.
Very good place to be seen plenty do do on way ,hop on bus stops close , we visited late afternoon, after cocktails at raffells

We reluctantly did the trip up to the Skypark due to the expense - but as our youngest son (16) was very keen we relented. Although I still consider the expense ridiculously exorbitant it was a great experience. The views were amazing and we spent a good hour at the top.

REVIEW_TITLE: Morning visit = no queues and a beautiful view
REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Sands Skypark during the day to avoid the crowds. At 11am there was no queue and we had plenty of space on the viewing deck. The views of the city, the bay and the gardens are incredible on a clear day. However, be aware of a couple of things that other reviews have mentioned - the pool area and gardens are for hotel guests only so you‚Äôll only be able to access a relatively small part of the roof and the restaurant is for guests only. There‚Äôs a small stall that sells drinks and souvenirs. It‚Äôs not the cheapest attraction in the city but it was a must see for us.

We visited the Marina Bay Sands hotel whilst in Singapore, went straight up to the rooftop bar for a spectacular view and was not disappointed.
The bar is open to non residents but is a little pricey, although this is to be expected, the infinity pool is only accessible to guests now, but the views from the bar are still great.
Would recommend a visit at least once
very expensive , you only get to see one part of the roof area. long queue to get in. great view from top.

The Skypark is now one of the most recognisable features of any city worldwide. The views over the city are spectacular and in particular you get a sense of the scale of the Gardens on the Bay and the incredibly busy shipping lanes off the coast of Singapore. The restaurant/bar at the Skypark (Lavo) has excellent views and whilst a little expensive is part of the experience of visiting Skypark

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth Every Penny spent for our Stay
REVIEW_BODY:
If you are guests at the hotel , it's free but otherwise too, view from the deck is impeccable.

A Must

This iconic hotel and it's rooftop pool, restaurants, and view deck are a must see. The pool area is only open to current hotel guests so if you want to experience the pool you must stay at the hotel. There are restaurants on either end that you can to without being a guest. As with any high end hotel, food and drink pricing is high. The views of Singapore are incredible.

The hotel is very large and busy, but once we found the correct elevator to go up to the observation floor all was good. You have to pay to go to the 56th floor and all it is is an open area to walk around and get a view of the city. We ended up going back down and then paid more to go back up on another elevator at different location to go to the 57th floor with a bar and had a drink. That floor is worth it if you want to eat, drink or sit down. The 56th has no place to sit and no shade.
We stayed at the hotel , views are breathtaking , nice pool , very relaxing . You are on top of the world amazing experience.my kids enjoyed the pool and view .

A little confusing on whether you can go to the very top as told different stories by different hotel reception staff - you can go to the very top where the pool and bar are but can only go into the bar if not a guest not the pool area - however the path leading into the bar has a great view of the pool and views of Singapore - you can go to the viewing floor below the top floor by paying an entrance fee

Awesome!! is the word. One must get there on the top on Marina Bay Sands Skypark just before twilight to see the complete landscape of Singapore change from Daylight to twilight to night time. Its beautiful in the night time with a complete view of the Sea coast and the ships along the coast line.

Great views all around but minimal facilities including seating and crowded. There are signs for features in the lsndscape but these are minimal and repeated. Expensive access, but everything in Singapore attracts a fee.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to celebrate new year!
REVIEW_BODY: Me and my husband and our teenage daughter celebrate new year in the sky park with a spectacular view over Singapore and the impressive fireworks. We were offered complimentary drinks and snacks and music was playing while we waited for the clock to turn twelve. Not much queue on our way up or crowded at the observation deck. Great value and a memorable way to celebrate new year!
Fun to do and amazing views we did the admission with an icy Singapore sling which was good but no where to sit down whilst you drink and served in a plastic cup though still worth it for the views

This is a place to visit when travelling to Singapore. It has magnificent views on the city and the bay to be enjoyed. Despite you should pay a fee to be admitted it is a must to visit. The fee will be exchanged by a drink at the bar.

Really good value at the Club 55 on top of Tower 2.
The bar downstairs was less than exciting, although the service was good. Music was too loud.
But, Club 55 was perfect -- a really exciting evening. Food was good; wine was excellent; service was outstanding and friendly; and, the dessert bar was....well... truly exceptional. Thank you Club 55!!! Well done good people!

The Marina Bay Sands Skypark is located on the 57th floor of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. You can either pay an admission fee of I think SG$35 or if you're a guest of the Hotel, entry is free. As you can probably imagine, a view from 57 floors up is awesome. It looks directly over the Harbour and Gardens by the Bay and you views over to Indonesia and Malaysia. This makes for great selfies and photos. There is merchandise available and when you go up, they take you picture and you can choose to buy this or not.
The Marina Bay Sands is a very impressive sight on the Singapore skyline. Well worth taking the time to actually travel up to level 57. Breathtaking views over Singapore and the bay.
Well worth a visit. Fantastic views from top of Singapore. Toilets on top floor and somewhere to get a drink and look at the amazing views
Had the opportunity to be at the lounge and have a drink, sipping it and viewing Singapore at leisure. Lovely evening. Worth the money.

Went for a staycation with my 3 years old gal. The room was bright and spacious. Toilet was clean and love the bathtub which was at the shower area. The floor around the basin would not be wet with such design.

The security guards were prompt in providing first aid to my gal when she fell down. They quickly provide us with ice pack and told us to look for them if my gal was unwell in the middle of the night. Kudos to their first class service.

Overall, love our 4D3N stay.

Ok don‚Äôt buy the sky deck tickets as this only gives you access to a small viewing area. Purchase the restaurant tickets $22 each including a drink and take the time to relax have a beer/Singapore sling and some food. The staff really try and help
You as next they can.
Definitely recommend this at least once.

Please do not be deceived by this, know exactly what your going to get. I genuinely thought we was paying to go up to spend several hours taking in the view, relaxing by the bar eating lunch and using the amazing infinity pool. In reality you pay s$33 to go up to a tiny and by tiny I mean the tip of one end of the Skypark to be crammed in to take pictures and use your voucher in a make shift bar for a almost non existent frozen Singapore sling!
Please know what your paying for as we didn‚Äôt!

I was not a guest at the hotel so was only allowed to go to the viewing desk on the ship. I would suggest doing this attraction instead of the flyer as the views are spectacular! Although very windy so don‚Äôt take a hat! You can spend as much time up there was you want at there are places to buy fast food and drink, souvenirs. The views are of the city itself and of gardens by the bay. You do get a small view of the swimming pool but the views of the other side of far better! It is rather pricy however what the facilities provided as once you get up there the isn‚Äôt much to do other than look out... would advise an hour max at this attraction
This is a unique and impressive building with awesome views. Definitely worth the ride up to see the city from on high

One night is enough as MBS is built for volume but the pool is a bucket list MUST DO!
Staff wonderful from check in to check out and the room divine but personally
Prefer Middle Road Intercontinental for its boutique size and elegance

Fantastic place with awesome view of Singapore from 54th floor. Humungous building. Upmarket shops but has a food court with great variety of food. Great to watch the light show at Garden s by the Bay from 54th floor.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you sleep here, you must go!
REVIEW_BODY: But I wouldn't pay the fare for the elevator just to get to the roof and back down... only hotel guests are allowed IN the pool.

REVIEW_TITLE: Much hyped but generally worth it
REVIEW_BODY: Great view but crowded even early morning. Nice they control access but is a little weird to have to pass security to go to the pool

Brilliant views of Marina Bay, CBD, Singapore Flyer and parts of the F1 race circuit.

Yes, you only get access to the observation deck (and there's no shelter if weather is bad).
You can get access to a bar / restaurant with a different (and more expensive) ticket.

No point visiting if the weather is bad (and remember it rains over 200 days of the year in Singapore (generally mid afternoon) so be sure to time your visit well (and consult the weather forecast).
Recommended place to visit .. try to get in around 6:30 pm so that you can see day light view and then night view ... if sky is clear then sunset looks gorgeous ...

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must visit but do without the drink option.
REVIEW_BODY: We had been in Singapore for 4 days and left this visit to the last day but it was certainly worthwhile. The views are nothing short of spectacular. We mistakenly thought we could sit in the bar and have our drink but no it was served from a kiosk and there is nowhere to rest weary legs.(we didn't walk up - we used the very fast lift!!) Plenty of visitors thought they would be able to see the famous infinity pool but you can only see a very small portion of it as understandably it is reserved for hotel guests only. You must choose a nice clear day to benefit fully from he superb views

Managed to pay a visit! But only up to observation deck not the infinity pool! Nice view and able to capture city view at night! Take note there is no shade if weather is bad. Visit only when it is good weather.

It‚Äôs a beautiful location to see view of beautiful Singapore. I just don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a great value however. Probably no. I would invest in stay at hotel instead and see it for free from pool and not public area over priced.

Located at L56 of Marina Bay Sands Hotel, anyone can pay a visit here without booking a room. (but the roof top swimming pool is only open to the hotel guests). Awesome bird view of whole marina Bay CBD buildings, Singapore flyer and gardens by the bay.
Entry fee: SGD23, really worthwhile...

REVIEW_TITLE: The best thing about the view is - the view! The terrace itself feels more like a cheaper cruise ship ...
REVIEW_BODY: This is perhaps Singapore's most famous building and, not least, views! It feels like the entire hotel is created solely for this magical world of skylines, skyscrapers and eternal sky against the evening sun and stars ... Nothing to the height scared, though the railing and glass walls are reassuringly high. The view is reasonably similar no matter what part of the roof terrace you buy tickets to - the difference lies in whether you are staying as part of the hotel and can enjoy the beautiful 'eternity pool' or 'just' visit the regular view deck (which is reminiscent of a cheaper Mediterranean cruise ship ). The choice of ticket purchase also affects whether you can sit at a real serving or just buy a cheap copy of a Singapore Sling drink in a simpler kiosk. Regardless, it is worth the money, time and effort to get up here and enjoy the beautiful city - try to hit the time around sunset, when the light is at its best!

REVIEW_TITLE: Only 10% of the roof is accessible
REVIEW_BODY: Once we arrived on the top we realised that we were limited to a very small proportion of the deck, about 10%. The remaining 90% is not accessible. So, you can not have a 360¬∞ view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Observation deck entry v bar entry
REVIEW_BODY:
Online observation deck entry includes tea drink for 20% off vs free entry Bar but with minimum charge. It's misleading to think the bar entry is free since both work out to be similar in cost.

Both have limited access to the top deck. With the bar, you are also limited by where you get seated. The outermost seats are still behind the observation deck. At the northern end, the observation deck extends at least 20 meters away from where the bar seating ends.

YMMV

Best place to unwind when in Singapore. Marina Bay Sands is equipped with literally everything from luxury shopping malls to roof top discos and casinos too. sky deck is always my first choice to unwind and enjoy the best view of the Singapore Skyline. The music and the ambiance are both fabulous.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent view of the city, but expensive
REVIEW_BODY: A must do in Singapore, but very expensive, circa $20 for a standard beer. Cost $20 each to get up to the top, which can be used as credit to purchase drinks, food etc up the top.

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect if only for the views
REVIEW_BODY: Ate at ace La Vie restaurant and whilst we couldn‚Äôt fault the food it is a bit pricy and aimed at tourists. However the view by night is to die for!

Something you must do to say you have done. Views are beautiful and a must see but once you have looked around there is not much else to see. I‚Äôm sure you could pay extra to go to the pool area but we didn‚Äôt. Would be better if you could use your pass all day as would be good to come back at night and see the lights of the city but it is stay as long as you like but only once. Glad I did it but won‚Äôt go again.
Everyone has already probably said it so I won‚Äôt harp on too much, but without sounding too cliche..... it‚Äôs a must do, no crowds, stinkin hot and wow what a view.

REVIEW_TITLE: I think I am Going to Stay Here Next Time
REVIEW_BODY: Spectacular views! We want to stay here next time in Singapore. Too bad we did not visit the pool...

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice to visit, but hard to get vantage points
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited at cost, with that charge credited toward food and drink, which are expensive.
Great views, but hard to get vantage points.

Unhindered views of city, marina and gardens by the bay.

Enjoy as hotel guest or buy a ticket.
Restaurant Cie Le Vie located on the deck behind the viewing points.

Located in marina bay sands hotel.
Take lift to 55, located within tower2 lifts.

I decided to go to the sky park only because I was staying at MBS and it is complimentary for hotel guests.

The views here are stunning! You can see the entire city from a 360 degree view, and it was less crowded than I expected it to be. There is also food and drinks up here so no need to grab them beforehand.

I‚Äôm glad I didn‚Äôt pay for the attraction because I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs worth the cost. It really depends on you though. It‚Äôs a fun attraction when it‚Äôs free, but I would pick another attractive (gardens by the bay) over this if there had to be a decision made.

Luckily, you can do this pretty quickly so there‚Äôs not a ton of time spend up here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Feel on Top of the World
REVIEW_BODY: The Sky Park on 57th floor is an unique experience and offers stunning views of Singapore. One doesn't get tired even after spending many hours. A must visit while in Singapore
The view is outstanding but the price is too high for a simple glimpse of the city from the 56th floor.

This is a picture perfect place.
Enjoy the beautiful view over Singapore.
Bring your foto/video camera!

REVIEW_TITLE: Why go to the SkyPark? Go up to the bar instead!!
REVIEW_BODY:
So many people were spending money to go to the skypark when, for much better value, you can go to Ce La Vie bar on level 57! A simple question at reception revealed you can go up to this classy bar with better views for virtually the same price.
Go to Tower 1 and the Ce La Vie desk on the ground level and purchase a ticket for ¬£11 English pounds. Then go up to level 57 and you use your ¬£11 ticket as credit at the bar for drink or food. For an extra ¬£2 we all enjoyed a fabulous cocktail with a much better atmosphere and incredible views. For the same price there were people just walking around a plain observation deck!!! They seemed completely crazy to us! Additionally, the bar wraps around so you can wander and get various views as well as going right to the edge of the famous infinity pool.
It was an amazing must-do experience in Singapore. Please don't waste your money on the SkyPark - go to Ce La Vie bar instead!
We stayed in the hotel, thus have access to it. It is very crowded during the afternoon. Recommended to go early

I think the photos tell the story
All the attractions are in this area
RED LINE on the metro
Enjoy.
Wear flat comfy shoes..
Lots of walking involved.

REVIEW_TITLE: Quarantined observation deck to keep the plebeians away
REVIEW_BODY:
I get that observation decks provide the most stunning views of city skylines.

When I saw the Marina Bay Sands I could not wait to see the view from the top. I thought $23 was a bit steep but hey, I‚Äôm only in Singapore for a day.

Little did I realize this gets you access to a tiny sliver of the north side of the deck. While the view is nice for a bit, there is little room to explore at all.

Oh, and to add insult to injury... they keep the adjacent restaurant sectioned off for guests only. Because you‚Äôre not really a guest and god forbid you try to spend your poor-person money at their fancy restaurant.

This place must make so much money in every facet it‚Äôs insulting to charge $23 to use an elevator.
We went to the Skypark after dinner on our first night in Singapore and the views were amazing especially overlooking the Gardens by the Bay and the vast number of ships at anchor off shore.

A different way to have a drink; relax and take in the views. We got some lovely views of the city and Gardens. Shame it was a cloudy day.

It costs S$22 pp to gain entrance to the bar / restaurant area at the top but this fee is redeemable against food and drink. A cocktail will set you back around S$23. Food is pricey e.g. S$24 for small plate of prawns. That said, huge numbers of people go there for dinner so clearly popular. Be prepared to have a credit card retained if you‚Äôre running a tab. There is a dedicated lift to take you all the way up. You can also pay to gain access to the infinity pool if you want a dip.

Well worth it for the experience

REVIEW_TITLE: A great view of the city
REVIEW_BODY:
Lovely to go to the top of the hotel to the observation desk - it is 57 floors up so the view is incredible.

We got a ticket that included the Singapore sling - not worth it in my opinion.

It's an amazing sky park
In level 57
You can see all around Singapore
There is restaurant and coffee shops
You can spend 4,5 hour's
A visit that is memorable and unforgetable. Love the scenary and the skyline. Singapore looks different and beautiful. Go and experience it before sunset.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome but only if you don‚Äôt mind heights
REVIEW_BODY:
We were on a 2 night stop over & got tickets from the hotel for the sky park and gardens by the bay . We went via the subway , which the hotel is close too.

The building or 3 towers is just awesome , a real feat of architecture and engineering . The ground floor has two hotel receptions , shops and restaurants & is very busy.

The skypark is at one end and wasn‚Äôt that easy to find initially. Staff are on hand to guide you .We went up all 55 floors & the reception area has a toilet and photo shop.

I don‚Äôt like heights so was very unnerved by being so high up so had to let my hubby take in the views & take some photos. There is a small cafe selling drinks and a gift shop but there is no where to sit. Clearly they don‚Äôt want you to stay up there for for too long. There is a restaurant too but on the day we went it closed at 2 pm

I honestly don‚Äôt know how they built this building as it is amazing but don‚Äôt expect to see the famous infinity pool as this is only for hotel guests and the skypark is only one end of the top floor so don‚Äôt expect to be able to walk around the whole level. The skypark area is surrounded by a tall glass barrier so is safe but you‚Äôve been warned if you don‚Äôt like heights think twice, I have never been so scared as I was on this trip.

We pre purchased our tickets from our hotel so we didn‚Äôt need to line up. The views are amazing & definitely worth a visit. There is a small cafe at top where you can buy a non alcoholic singapore sling slushie. Refreshing on a hot day.
That is one of the reason why I wanted to travel to Singapore. Amazing infinity pool. I would not call it the best in the world but definitely one of the best :)

A must to obtain an overall view of mainland Singapore. Absolutely amazing how tall this hotel is which offers unrivalled views from shipping, local housing, business towers and the general layout of this vibrant island.

People come here for the fabulous views and it is impressive. Visitors are controlled via elevator and the observation deck is not overcrowded. There is a bar and a souvenir shop but that's about it. The restaurant and bar are reserved for hotel guests but you can obtain a reservation from the concierge in the lobby. The lobby of the hotel is busy with shoppers browsing through high-level shops and restaurants. From the lobby, you can visit the casino as long as you present a passport. Access to the gardens can be gained via upper level elevators and the hop on hop off bus stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel lobby, observation deck, the gardens and the casino are must-see attractions at this location. Don't rush through it!

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place especially sunset and night view
REVIEW_BODY:
Excellent view of the city from sands sky park.we visited around 5.30 pm and sat there till 8.00 PM so we can have both day and night views.

We can also see garden by bay light show at 7.45 pm from here but sound will not reach here.
I was a little disappointed with this overpriced attraction. I spent less than 30 minutes there perhaps it would be more attractive if you visit in the evening or night.

We went in the morning and so it was not so busy at the top although it became busier after a while. The views were wonderful and because you can walk around the platform you get almost 360 degree views across Singapore. The ticket only gives access to the viewing platform and not the swimming pool area which is reserved for hotel guests.
You can also enjoy a frozen Singapore Sling as you look across the city.
My only negative (and why I have given this 4 and not 5 stars) is that there were no places to sit and there was not much shade and so, although you can spend as long as you like there, it is not comfortable to do so.
However, I would recommend this to any visitor to Singapore because it's a unique opportunity to view this beautiful city.
Looks good and promising in the day time as well as in the night too. Getting taxi in the night also is not a problem.
Got to see from the top deck and I could see the shore from there.They even put map and explaination for each buildings and monuments close to the glass.
You can¬¥t miss to stay at least one night at this hotel. That is the only way to get in this amazing pool.

REVIEW_TITLE: Like the Maldives on a roof!
REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful place. If you are a hotel guest access is free. There is a nightclub terrace bar on Tower 3 and a large Italian bar and grill on top of tower 1 in between them there is a giant infinity pool. There are loads of seats and beds in a variety of options, there are jacuzzi pools and observation seats. The pool is huge and split into family zone and adults only. There is an abundance of staff bringing drinks and food to you. In the main concourse area there is a large bar and diner by Wolfgang Puck and you can sit and dine in the main area or the bar anytime.
Above all (excuse the pun!)
To swim to the waters edge and look down 55 stores to the marina below is an experience not to missed. H a cocktail in hand and look down on the forest and gardens behind the hotel is just wonderful.
As with everywhere you go in this hotel, the staff are great. Lots of friendly people more than happy to go the extra mile to make you happy and comfortable
A great place - a must see on your visit to Singapore
The race going above or coming down the 57 storeys was alike an aeroplane landing at high speed. The complete view of the skyline of Singapore can be seen. It is a plce that one should not miss.

My wife and I recently visited Singapore after a cruise from Fremantle. We decided to checkout the Skypark on top of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel to get a good perspective and overview of this beautiful city. After purchasing our tickets we took the lift to the skypark and were certainly not disappointed with the views of Singapore's skyline and the harbour. We then decided to have something to eat at the restaurant adjacent to the skypark, but were informed that we could not enter the restaurant from the skydeck and would have to leave the skypark via the lift and return to a different level before entering this restaurant. This seemed a little bit odd considering there was an entrance via a couple of stairs from the skydeck. We were also informed that once we left the skypark we would not be able to return. Apparently the operators of the 'Skypark' and the adjacent restaurant were not prepared to co-operate, hence the ludicrous decision to prevent people on the skydeck entering the restaurant. For a tourist destination this was a little disappointing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice but not worth the money
REVIEW_BODY:
Ok, you have a good view (but note: you are only at the very end of the terrace (corner towards wheel). But you can only have a beer/dring out of a plastic cup. You can't go to the restaurant/bar. That you have to book/pay separately. Also not vice-versa.
And honetly the hotel itself isn't worth to stay there (too expensive, too crowded).
In other cities like NY you have more to see on such a terrace

The view from the infinity pool is amazing. You can even see the laser show directly from top every evening. Food is good too. There is separate adults only pool. the fact not mentioned on promotions is that its very crowded. That is bound to happen in a hotel with 2500 rooms or so.

We visited the skypark on an organized tour. The views were beautiful but as most of the roof is taken up with the hotel pool we were confined to a tiny section. A bit disappointing but definitely worth the experience
Great views from the top. Clear barrier on the edge to see city skyline and surrounding area. fee is charged.

The most stunning architecture in Singapore and $23 to go up the lift to floor 56 or 57 and what for? We were aware that we wouldn't have access to the pool or hotel areas, but the fact that there wasn't even a decent cafe or bar to enjoy the views from was pretty poor. You could buy a drink in one bar which was basically a counter.
The views were amazing and we got some great photos with the zoom at its bests - photos better than the reality

REVIEW_TITLE: of course, it is a must!
REVIEW_BODY: During our stay at the hote, we came in the morning for a swim and came to the afternoon for sun bathing, drinks...enjoying every minutes of it...

REVIEW_TITLE: No cover for when it rains and not great frozen singapore sling
REVIEW_BODY:
I have to say I am pretty disappointed with our experience .

We bought a ticket for 33 dollars which included a frozen Singapore Sling.
On the day we went it rained and we have been made aware by the staff which was nice . We asked then if we can transfer the ticket to another day but this was not possible ( so what's the point of pointing out the rain as it had been raining all day )

The view on the top is stunning but there is no rain cover at all and we have been told we have to have our cocktail walking around in the rain. Cocktail was a cheap small class of ready made stuff. Not tasty and not worth 7 dollars . Not quite the experience I was looking for.
After making a bit of a fuzz we were aloud to go up the bar and finish our cocktail .
Not a 5 star experience

We had been told that this was a must do in Singapore. We went up tower 3 on a particularly hot and humid day but the views were absolutely worth it. The day was really clear so we could clearly see all around. Highly recommend.

Thought it was a great idea to go to the top for $23 and this included a drink from the bar plus tax - so at the top you can‚Äôt go to the observation deck ( different price ) only to the bar area - great view and beautiful at night - very busy which is expected but not really with tourists mostly workers at th end of their day.
There was one downfall where the bar waitstaff were rude and ignorant and I have never been to a bar where the bar staff use their fingers to put the fruit and ice in to your drink - when I questioned this the manager said ‚ÄúI have worked here for 5 years and your the first person to ever ask me that ‚Äú enough said !
Been there now done that ! Great view but that‚Äôs all it‚Äôs got going for it !

Stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for only one night but this place left its mark on me. A beautiful luxurious hotel with comfortable large rooms. Stayed on the 14th floor and had a view to die for with a huge window looking out over the water. Had room service in the evening by the window whilst watching the laser show on the water.
The hotel infinity pool is to die for and was the most incredible experience looking over the edge, soaking up the sun looking out over the beautiful views.

This is a fabulous place and we had drinks at both the bars at the top of tower 1 & 3. At tower 1 it is free to go up and views are excellent. At tower 3 you pay $22 which is redeemed at the bar and their is an additional payment to enter the viewing platform which I don‚Äôt think is worthwhile.
Drinks in both bars are expensive as you‚Äôd imagine but still worth the visit.

One of the absolute bucket list items of our recent trip to Singapore was the Skypark at Marina Bay Sands. It lived up to our expectations and then some. 360 degree views of the city and harbour were absolutely stunning, including a Birdseye view of the other bucket list item, Gardens by the Bay.
Reasonably priced and easily accessed, it is an absolute must do when in Singapore. A photographers haven, but if you want the professional touch, a professional photographer is on hand and for a reasonable fee, will supply you a selection of amazing shots using green screen technology. Sure it‚Äôs cheating but so what, the pictures are impressive.
The views and the Design of the Magnificent Building are worth the price to go to the top.Amazing Architecture.

How could we visit Singapore and not spend a night at the marina bay sands, the rooftop pool was amazing and the perfect temperature, only downside was needing your room card to visit the restroom, cocktails on the roof then dinner at lavo, great service and atmosphere but the meals could be a little more generous. Shopping across the road and casino if thats your thing, then theres the gardens with an amazing light show at night.
This hotel is a sight that has to be seen, modern practical rooms with great views, only downside was after paying a big chunk on our room they wanted to charge us for milk for our coffee as it is not supplied.
Overall 5 stars, just do it.

This was limited - to purchase a ticket I had to use the escelator as there was no lift access. Once at the top the view was magnificant but there were no seats for me to rest and I was on crutches. There was very little shade or shelter either.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to see the Singapore Skyline
REVIEW_BODY:
We pre purchased the tickets direct from the Marine Sands Hotel web site and also paid for a Singapore Sling slush as part of the package

We visited during the early evening arriving at approx 7pm and found the organisation to be rather chaotic partly due to the large number of people to few staff

When we got to the top we found that you collected the Singapore Sling Slush from a small cafe at the top who also sold other refreshments, there‚Äôs also a bar at the top where you can buy alcohol etc.

The views were amazing and we were able to watch the Gardens by The Bay evening show from the top, having seen it the previous evening at ground level, it was equally as impressive

Well worth a visit

Did the must do thing, bought the tickets walked completely through the bottom of the hotel to go to the top to find that you can‚Äôt go all the way along the booking platform. Views are good but not worth the money.

Firz was much more polite than the Pinoy lady service at the pool, whom was very rude and cold in answering with a yes & no to my questions and even made me carry my own table to my cabana. I had to checked out by 12.30pm and Firz tried to ensure my angus burger in time despite me ordering at 12pm. Thanks to kitchen and chef too for expediting my order!

No charge for hotel guests and a nominal 20 odd SGD charge otherwise.

Lifts were pretty busy and about 20 people in the evening queue.

Once upstairs you can spend as much time as you like. The private entrance to the infinity pool is key card only - although you can go into the c‚Äôest la vie bar no issue.

There is a souvenir shop that also serves food and beverage.

Fantastic views - see the F1 track, gardens, high rise towers and beyond over the bay.

The experience gives a nice aerial view of the city. Be prepared to stand in queue for the lift. Also time your visit such that you are able to see the light & laser show from above. My visit was during the night but I guess the sunset must be beautiful to watch too.

This is the place to get fantastic views, not the giant Ferris wheel. Not cheap but worth it. You get gouged for food and drink too, so bring your own.
Only one negative, there was absolutely no place to sit down, no seats at all, and no shelter from sun or rain ( the restaurant was off-limits to us when we attended) so your stay at the top will be limited by how long your legs hold out. For old people (like me!) I thought that was a bit shabby, even though it is a sneaky way for the operators to ensure people don‚Äôt stay all day.
Kim W, Gippsland, Australia
We went up at night on a beautiful still night. Just so lovely able to see both ways. The city lights just great

The MBS is one of the well-known hotel in the world. Especially the infinity pool, a little bit crowd as usual, but once you jump into the pool. It's amazing. A great atmosphere and a good picture to be taken.

Visited and stayed at MBS earlier this year
Went to pool for a swim
It was totally packed by parents children and sightseeing public
Did not enter the water as I had concerns about the quality of the water with the amount of people using the facility
Overall the whole area was full of people and it was not a place to relax or stay for too long
The views from the top are indeed excellent but the whole experience was disappointing and I will not be returning

REVIEW_TITLE: If you don‚Äôt live in the hotel you can‚Äôt go to the sky park.
REVIEW_BODY: This was a little bit disappointing... Yes, you can buy tickets to go up visit the boat and check the view but if you don‚Äôt live in the hotel you have access only to the front/nose of the boat and can‚Äôt enjoy the pool or the park.

This is a good view from the top of the Marina bay sands hotel. Just keep in mind that you only have access to the very eastern end, so no taking a dip on the pool. The only downside for me was the price. For a family of 4 it cost $104. A bit expensive I thought for an elevator ride.
it was indeed a breathtaking and fantastic experience. The service together with the ambiance is beyond comparison to what we have seen else where.
If you‚Äôre not lucky enough to stay at this hotel - do the next best thing and go to the top and look across Singapore‚Äôs amazing skyline. You can see much from up there - it‚Äôs worth the money.
It is definitely a highlight of this hotel. Beautiful views of the city, relaxed and a great perk when you stay at the hotel

Bought a ticket & wen tup in the elevator. Unfortunately, we didn't realise that you needed a separate ticket to enter the bar/restaurant. That ticket had to purchassed at ground floor, an dit was too late by the time we were on the top of the building. Lose a start for that. Too be honest, the gardens were 100 times better.

Although it was a misty day when I visited the 'Skypark' because of Indonesia annual fire burning, I had a good view of Marina Bay and the surrounding areas including the 'Gardens by the Bay'. At this level there is no access to the bar. I would recommend paying extra and go to the bar a level higher where one can relax and enjoy the view with a drink or two specially if it a hot day. Please no not forget when buying ticket to mention that you are a senior citizen if you are. You will get discount and if you flew by Singapore Airline you get further discounts.

To get access to the Skypark you must go to the Sands Hotels. The Skypark ticket office is just by the side of the hotel. While the ticket for the Bar observation area is within the corridor of the hotel. It is fairly easy to find either.

Was it worth it? I think so for the sceneries. Choose a clear day if it is possible.

Although the views are amazing, the fact that there is no shade, nowhere to sit and limited space we were very disappointed. We understand that you need to encourage people to get through quickly and don‚Äôt want them hanging around too long it was not worth the money.

REVIEW_TITLE: Don‚Äôt bother with skypark, go to the bar on 57th floor
REVIEW_BODY: Didn‚Äôt go to skypark, which you have to pay to go on the viewing deck. Go to tower 3 and as to have a drink at Ce La Vi bar on the 57th floor (skypark is on 56). They charge you 22sgd to go up, but you get a voucher to spend those 22 on drinks. We had a pint of Stella for 21sgd++, which is only slightly more expensive than Clarke Quay for example. The view is fantastic. You can see the infinity pools but are not allowed to enter that area.

Firstly it is expensive. Secondly, the view isn‚Äôt the great and you can only walk around about half of top of Tower 3. The other areas are restricted to hotel guests.

Better scenery to just walk around the marina or garden by the bay.

Really wish we hadn‚Äôt gone.

A must see in Singapore. The view is magnificent - not to be missed at night. The restaurants on the top of the towers are incredibly delicious. If possible stay at the hotel and enjoy the amenities.
An architectural treasure.
Can see the whole Singapore from this roof top observation deck at the Marina Sands Hotel. Very nice place to take photos for great memory of visit to Singapore.
It was a beautiful opportunity to see the laser lights from the skypark. We spent the whole day and enjoyed the views so much. Definitely will return when I return to Singapore again

We visited Marina Bay Sands Sky Park Observation Deck

We experienced the most breathtaking and incredible 180degrees view of Singapore, we got there just after 8pm, on a Thursday evening, unfortunately we missed the Spectra light and water shows, but we still had an amazing time, it‚Äôs a shame though, restaurant is only accessible to hotel guests but there‚Äôs a small bar sells drink drink, we tried their Singapore Sling while enjoying the magnificent views.

We booked our tkts through Klook at a discounted price of ¬£11.16, it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit to see the view of Singapore from 200 metres above the ground,

This amazing building is awesome to just look at from the bay, but up on the Skydeck fantastic views of Singapore.Buy tix in advance save $5
Brought mine at hotel &skip the line.
Golden bay sands was the best place to go 100% loved it and then down to the light by the bay show amazing. A must see to is Merlion amazing what is there not to love about Singapore.

Great shopping centre
Walking around mbs area.
Canal in the mall.
Lots of boutique and high end stores.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit the Sky Bar Lounge, for Exquisite Cocktails And Liquour of yur Choice, with Commanding Vies of the City and Harbou
REVIEW_BODY: This is outstanding Sky-Bar, atop the Hotel Singapore Sands Marina Bay, decked on the Roof of this Unique Structure of this outstanding Super Premium Hotel in Singapore. They serve Excellent Hot Whole " Edamammee" Beans with their natural skin, and it is a Treat to peel one by one and relish the Unique Taste

REVIEW_TITLE: The hotel to stay when you want an unforgettable memory
REVIEW_BODY: The pool area and skypark are the architectural highlight of Asia. Staying here is so special, it is a real wonder how this view, feeling and delicious hotel and park were completed.
Very nice view but way too overpriced. I recommend the bar instead that has the same view and you can see the infinity pool too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Observation Deck with Marvellous View of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
A breathtaking observation deck just next to the infinity pool provide a spectacular birdeyes view of the wonders of Singapore.
There's a nice cafe joint for those who enjoy cupper coffee with the views.

REVIEW_TITLE: great views, a must on everyones bucket list
REVIEW_BODY: what a wonderful oasis above the skyline. It is visible from every vantage point in the city, and quite the conversation piece. It is hot as heck and expensive. It is a jewel in Singapores Skyline and a money making tourist attraction. Nice to look at.

This is definitely well worth going to whilst visiting Singapore. We paid for the option that included a free drink whilst at the sky deck and it was still cheaper than a few sky towers we have visited across the world. The views were amazing at the top, especially of gardens by the bay.

Had been here in the late evening. Could catch a glimpse of spectra show from top. Usually it's too crowded in the evening. But nonetheless the views are worth it. Pls do not miss when u plan a trip to SG.

REVIEW_TITLE: Phew it was hot at the top.
REVIEW_BODY:
Sadly only spent about 15 minutes at the top here. There was no shelter from the heat, except inside the small shop. The temperature that day 36 %degrees, with the humidity at 78 % degrees. The view from top is just amazing, a photographers delight. We had booked with the entry ticket, a meal at the Rise restaurant, wrongly thinking it was the place we could see situated in the pictures at the very top, but, it was not to be. The restaurant is in the fact on the ground floor. The meal was ok though.
So it‚Äôs been there, done it, but would not choose to go back, unless much, much colder

My husband and I visited Marina Bay Sands while on holiday in Singapore. The view from the very top of the complex was breathtaking. We also saw all the beautiful gardens and trees all lit up at night. Spectacular show full of color.Definitely would love to come back and spend more time walking through the garden domes which we didn't get a chance too. Such a beautiful place to visit and stay.

We traveled on business so time was limited but the skypark is a fabulous place to enjoy the day around a pool to cool off in while enjoying cocktails and the awesome view of the city skyline. A worthwhile visit.
This is the reason to stay at the hotel. It's crowded so go early, but once in place you can order drinks and food. Probably the most spectacular pool in the world.

One time experience! Huge infinity pool with a beautiful view. There is a service to the pool and it is great. Fair prices and pretty decent menu. Have had the angus burger and the toasted ham sandwich and it was very good. The cocktails were ok. On the other side there is a jacuzzi also with a great view to the gardens. Very recommended!
Amazing sunset! You can enjoy a drink on the rooftop and watch the sunset then tou can go downstairs to see the water and light show
Great picturesque place. Better to visit at dusk so u can get a daytime and night time view . It‚Äôs beautiful when lit up.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely view, but long wait for the elevator when leaving
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a landmark destination and it attracts lots of tourists and visitors. I‚Äôd paid $22, on a Thursday evening, which is like a cover charge to Ce la Vi bar & restaurant on 57th floor.

It was a cloudy day so I didn‚Äôt get to see the beautiful sunset. The sky was somewhat light orangy and pinkish. Nevertheless, a panoramic view of the city and Marina Bay.

From the 57th floor I went down to 56th floor Observation Deck for another look. That was a mistake, as the queue for the down elevator was about half an hour. Thank goodness the guests were all very patient and the queue moved in a orderly manner.
A must visit. The view from roof bars are super cool. The buildings are totally unique and a landmark in Singapore.

The Marina Bay Sands Sky Park Infinity Pool is phenomenal. An absolute must experience while staying at the hotel. Poolside service is great! But, get there early to get your lounge chair. Bring lots of sunscreen!

Busy busy lobby before you go up in the lift.
Nowhere to sit out on the observation deck...obviously want you to pay the money and get down quickly!
Yes great views but wouldn‚Äôt bother again

The View is fantastic from here... You can nearly see what they are eating in Batam Indonesia. The Ambience is lovely. One of the best Man made view in the world. You are nearly eye to eye with the pilots in the passing Airplanes but they don't have a Swimming pool on board.
We paid $20 per person to visit the Skypark and although there is a good view unless you are an hotel guest you are restricted to going to the top. A waste of money.

Visited this hotel to check it out before booking, mainly due to Crazy Rich Asians Movie!!! Thank goodness I did. There is an observation deck and the Ce La Vie bar that is open to anyone for about $22. Unfortunately if you are using the pool you‚Äôre looked over - like you‚Äôre in a zoo and the foyers are busy with tourists (yes like me) having a look. For such an expensive room rate I‚Äôd preferably choose the Raffles for the heritage or for a better overall experience the Sofitel City Centre Club Room and just visit the Marina Bay to have a look see. Hint : don‚Äôt pay for the observation deck, pay for the Ce La Vie bar and you get a drink as well!!!!
Marvellous view over Singapore with a nice cocktail or beer in you hand. The pool is absolutely amazing, unfortunately only for hotel guest but to see it is already an attraction. Must see!!
